questions.Scenario: The manager asks about increasing company value. What do you focus on?

Options.text: Streamline production for scalable growth (MO)
Ensure stronger risk management to protect valuation (CRM)
Grow recurring revenue and manage long-term assets (FAR)
Launch new services and expand customer reach (BM)

questions.Scenario: New regulation increases business taxes. What is your analytic step?

Options.text: Advise clients how strategy may shift due to tax increase (BM)
Review operations to find areas for cost-cutting (MO)
Model impact on profit margins and tax expense (FAR)
Summarize regulatory changes for compliance leadership (CRM)

questions.Scenario: Your company considers entering a new market. You:

Options.text: Check for local business licensing and regulatory issues (CRM)
Analyze the impact on overall financials using past data (FAR)
Research competition and customer trends to support the decision (BM)
Coordinate an operational assessment of supply and logistics (MO)

questions.Scenario: There’s an industry price drop on key materials. Your approach?

Options.text: Adjust order schedules to take advantage of price changes (MO)
Review contracts for compliance with price adjustment terms (CRM)
Project new cost structure and profitability (FAR)
Recommend new pricing strategy to attract more clients (BM)

questions.Scenario: Management wants to understand recent inflation effects. You:

Options.text: Check compliance of vendor contracts for inflation clauses (CRM)
Adjust inventory and procurement orders to hedge costs (MO)
Compare year-over-year costs to highlight expense drivers (FAR)
Lead a price review of offerings in the current marketplace (BM)

questions.Scenario: Industry peers launch a new, disruptive technology. Your best response?

Options.text: Benchmark the innovation against business strategy (BM)
Ensure all data or tech adoption meets legal standards (CRM)
Plan pilot projects to test operational integration (MO)
Assess financial viability to adopt or compete (FAR)
Project long-term cost benefit vs. initial outlay (FAR)
Negotiate terms and seek competitive supplier quotes (BM)
Map current ops to identify which functions can be outsourced (MO)
Ensure outsourcing process follows all labor laws (CRM)

questions.Scenario: A local economic recession is forecasted. Your first move?

Options.text: Shift resources to business lines less affected by downturn (MO)
Support sales with market opportunity analysis (BM)
Reassess client contracts for risk clauses and continuity (CRM)
Contingency plan for cash flow and asset write-downs (FAR)

questions.Scenario: A public sector project is announced. What is your business analysis?

Options.text: Identify stakeholders and propose value to end-users (BM)
Review project compliance with tender rules (CRM)
Plan the project rollout to match public service specs (MO)
Assess bid pricing and cost recovery against norms (FAR)

questions.Scenario: Exchange rates fluctuate sharply. As an early-career analyst, you:

Options.text: Review compliance requirements for FX contracts (CRM)
Suggest risk hedges based on market research (BM)
Advise ops on inventory or payment timing (MO)
Calculate currency effects on imports/exports in reporting (FAR)
